introText: Today’s digest highlights policy moves on immigration and tech regulation, major AI and consumer tech developments, international and Dutch political news, notable sports results, and cultural coverage. The items are organized into Policy & International Affairs, Technology, Arts & Culture, Sports, Netherlands & Europe News, and Economy & Markets.

categories.commentary: Updates on antitrust regulation, immigration policy, and how international relations intersect with technology governance.

articles.title: The US government is taking a second stab at breaking up Google
articles.summary: The Verge reports the government’s renewed antitrust push against Google, focusing on ad-tech remedies and potential structural changes; remedies could include divestitures or behavioral restrictions, with potential effects on competition, publishers, and consumers.

articles.title: Trump hits H-1B visas with $100,000 fee, targeting the program that launched Elon Musk and Instagram
articles.summary: TechCrunch analyzes President Trump’s proposal to impose a $100,000 fee on H-1B visas and its implications for U.S. tech competitiveness, industry groups, and workers, including interactions with visa processes and potential exemptions.

articles.title: White House Outlines a TikTok Deal With a U.S. Board
articles.summary: The White House describes a TikTok governance plan with a seven-director board (six Americans) to oversee the platform, outlining governance terms, timelines, and potential impact on operations and data practices.

articles.title: Netanyahu asked U.S. to press Egypt on military build up in Sinai
articles.summary: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu asked the United States to press Egypt to scale down a recent military build-up in the Sinai amid the Gaza war, citing regional security concerns.

articles.title: They Were Promised a Glimpse of America. They Got Abuse and Exploitation.
articles.summary: The Times reports on abuse and exploitation faced by J-1 visa participants, highlighting oversight gaps and labor protections under the cultural-exchange program.

articles.title: 4 Takeaways From the Times Investigation Into the J-1 Visa Program
articles.summary: The Times presents four key findings from its investigation into the J-1 visa program, focusing on oversight gaps, participant treatment, and regulatory framework.

articles.title: Drie Russische gevechtsvliegtuigen boven Estland: wat betekent dat?
articles.summary: NRC analyzes the interception of three Russian fighter jets above Estonia and discusses implications for NATO airspace security, deterrence, and Baltic regional dynamics.

articles.title: After Helping to Oust a Dictator, They Are Targets of the New Regime
articles.summary: The Times reports arrests of loyalists from the ousted Nicaraguan regime as Ortega consolidates power, signaling potential human rights concerns and regional stability risks.

categories.commentary: Coverage of AI, hardware, and consumer-tech developments, including mobile devices, wearables, and user interfaces.

articles.title: Windows 11 is adding another Copilot button nobody asked for
articles.summary: The Verge discusses a new Copilot button in Windows 11, evaluating its placement, function, and potential impact on usability and learning curves.

articles.title: Nest is dead, long live Google Home
articles.summary: The Verge analyzes Google’s plan to fold Nest into Google Home, addressing compatibility, AI features, and migration paths for Nest devices within a unified brand strategy.

articles.title: OpenAI might be developing a smart speaker, glasses, voice recorder, and a pin
articles.summary: The Verge reports on unconfirmed rumors about OpenAI hardware such as a smart speaker, AR glasses, a voice recorder, and a wearable pin, noting the speculative basis and awaiting official confirmation.

articles.title: The wafer-thin iPhone Air is surprisingly strong
articles.summary: The Verge reports on a durability test of the iPhone Air, finding it more resilient than expected given its thin design, with discussion of trade-offs in durability.

articles.title: iPhone 17 Pro teardown reveals larger camera sensors, and a repair-friendly design
articles.summary: 9to5Mac details the iPhone 17 Pro teardown, noting larger camera sensors and a design that emphasizes repairability, with a video offering deeper component-level insights.

articles.title: Chrome is Google’s first iPhone app with Liquid Glass
articles.summary: 9to5Mac reports that Google Chrome for iPhone and iPad adopts Liquid Glass UI with iOS 26, marking a design shift for Google’s iPhone browser.

articles.title: Apple updates Final Cut Pro and Camera apps with full iPhone 17 support
articles.summary: Apple releases updates to Final Cut Pro and Camera apps to add full support for the iPhone 17 lineup, aligning editing software with new hardware features.

articles.title: iPhone Air bend test affirms Apple’s claim of most durable iPhone ever, front glass scratch resistance also impresses
articles.summary: A hands-on bend test suggests the iPhone Air is highly durable and features strong front glass scratch resistance, corroborating Apple’s durability claims.

articles.title: Five upgrades to look forward to with the rumored MacBook Pro overhaul next year
articles.summary: The article surveys five rumored upgrades for a 2026 MacBook Pro overhaul, previewing potential changes to display, chassis, connectivity, and performance.

articles.title: Apple boosts iPhone 17 production targets following strong pre-order demand
articles.summary: Apple increases production targets for iPhone 17 in response to strong pre-orders, describing alignment of manufacturing with demand during launch weeks.

articles.title: Anker debuts three new charging essentials for iPhone 17, iPhone Air, and more
articles.summary: Anker introduces three new charging products for iPhone 17 and iPhone Air, including a slim 35W Nano charger with dual ports and built-in cable.

articles.title: The AI boom is great for stocks, not so much for jobs
articles.summary: Axios argues AI investment is boosting stocks and growth but not broad job creation, highlighting policy questions on retraining and safety nets as the economy retools.

categories.commentary: Obituaries, arts reporting, and programs blending tech with the performing arts.

articles.title: Marian Burros, Food Writer Famed for Her Plum Torte and More, Dies at 92
articles.summary: The obituary notes Marian Burros’s career as a food writer, including her Plum Torte and contributions to Times coverage across culinary topics.

articles.title: Diane Martel, Inventive Director of Music Videos, Dies at 63
articles.summary: Diane Martel is remembered for influential music videos and collaborations with major artists, shaping early-2000s visual culture.

articles.title: Lincoln Center’s Collider Fellows explore how tech could transform the performing arts
articles.summary: TechCrunch reports on Lincoln Center’s Collider Fellows and projects where technology intersects with performing arts, including collaborations and experimental work.

categories.commentary: Recaps and notable moments from Dutch football competitions.

articles.title: Samenvattingen eredivisie: Ihattaren, Van Hooijdonk en Schouten de goudhaantjes
articles.summary: NOS highlights key performances from the sixth round of the Eredivisie, focusing on Ihattaren, Van Hooijdonk, and Schouten.

articles.title: Late kopgoal Van Hooijdonk brengt NAC zege op puntloos Heracles
articles.summary: NAC Breda defeats Heracles with a late header after falling behind early in the match.

articles.title: Vitesse viert rentree in volgepakt Gelredome met emotionele zege op Helmond Sport
articles.summary: Vitesse earns its first win of the season in a full Gelredome, overcoming Helmond Sport with an emotional victory.

categories.commentary: Dutch and European incidents, politics, and social issues reported by Dutch outlets.

articles.title: Minstens 30 aanhoudingen en twee gewonde agenten bij 'ongekend geweld' in Den Haag
articles.summary: NOS reports at least 30 arrests and two wounded officers in Den Haag amid what is described as unprecedented violence.

articles.title: Ook morgen geannuleerde vluchten op Brussels Airport door cyberaanval
articles.summary: NOS reports possible flight cancellations at Brussels Airport tomorrow due to a cyberattack, with disruption and mitigation steps noted.

articles.title: Elsfest loopt uit op rellen: waterkanonnen en brandende politieauto’s rond het Malieveld
articles.summary: NRC describes protests during Elsfest that escalated into rioting, with police using water cannons and vehicles set on fire.

articles.title: Bezorgde lezers tijdens de Lezersmars: ‘Niemand mag bepalen wat een ander mag lezen’
articles.summary: NRC reports on Lezersmars concerns about censorship and freedom to read, including participant reflections and context about democratic access to information.

articles.title: Zes nieuwkomers bij de 27 partijen die mogen deelnemen aan de verkiezingen, waaronder FNP en Vrede voor Dieren
articles.summary: NRC outlines six new parties allowed to participate in upcoming elections, including FNP and Vrede voor Dieren, with notes on eligibility and rules.

articles.title: Burgers hebben genoeg van al die meningen. Zodat Den Haag maar afziet van al te verhit debat
articles.summary: An analysis piece arguing for a more mature, less polarizing public debate in The Hague, while maintaining important questions and urgency.

categories.commentary: AI, economics, and market implications of technology and policy.

articles.title: The AI boom is great for stocks, not so much for jobs
articles.summary: Axios argues that AI-driven investment and infrastructure growth are boosting stocks but not broad employment, raising questions about retraining and safety nets.

articles.title: Indiase econoom Rajan zag in 2005 de financiële crisis al aankomen, en vreest nu nieuwe problemen door lage rentes. ‘Dat is bijna een ijzeren wet’
articles.summary: In dit interview bespreekt Raghuram Rajan zijn waarschuwingen over financiële risks in een economie met langdurige lage rentetarieven en hoge schulden, met mogelijke beleidsopties.

articles.title: Where America's pumpkins are grown
articles.summary: Axios maps pumpkin production across states, highlighting Illinois as a leading producer and discussing supply chains and seasonal demand.

introText: This digest covers technology and AI developments, policy and regulatory changes, global politics and diplomacy, science and security stories, and sports and entertainment industry updates. It summarizes product launches, corporate deals, government actions, and security issues using only the information in the headlines and provided metadata.

introText: This digest highlights a major Nvidia-Intel AI hardware collaboration, Google’s Gemini expansions in Chrome, and the Windows/Xbox Copilot rollout. It also covers antitrust and regulatory actions in tech markets, international diplomacy around TikTok, and a range of sports, culture, and Dutch news updates, along with cybersecurity and consumer-tech news.

articles.title: Nvidia and Intel’s $5 billion deal is apparently about eating AMD’s lunch
articles.summary: Verge reports a roughly $5 billion collaboration between Nvidia and Intel to co-develop PC and data-center chips, combining Nvidia’s AI accelerators with Intel’s processors and manufacturing. The article notes potential competition pressure on AMD and discusses regulatory and supply-chain implications.

articles.title: Google Gemini in Chrome
articles.summary: Verge reports Google will broaden Gemini’s presence in Chrome, enabling Gemini-powered features for browsing and automation across Mac and Windows, with agentic capabilities for tasks such as form-filling and scheduling.

articles.title: Xbox Copilot arrives on Windows 11 PCs worldwide
articles.summary: Verge covers the rollout of Xbox Copilot across Windows 11 PCs, integrating AI-assisted features into the Xbox Game Bar and Windows gaming experience, with considerations around privacy and resource use.

articles.title: Intel says Arc GPUs will live on after Nvidia deal
articles.summary: The Verge reports that Intel plans continued Arc GPU support and roadmap despite the Nvidia collaboration, discussing implications for competition and ecosystem viability.

articles.title: Samsung brings ads to US fridges
articles.summary: Verge reports Samsung introducing advertising on US smart refrigerators, detailing business rationale, consumer impact, and privacy considerations.

articles.title: OpenAI’s research on AI models deliberately lying is wild
articles.summary: TechCrunch notes OpenAI’s internal research into whether AI models can deliberately lie under certain prompts, discussing experiments to probe truthfulness and the challenges of ensuring reliability.

articles.title: How AI startups are fueling Google’s booming cloud business
articles.summary: TechCrunch analyzes how independent AI startups are driving demand for Google Cloud with tools and data pipelines built on the platform, exploring partnerships and enterprise use cases.

articles.title: Notion launches agents for data analysis and task automation
articles.summary: TechCrunch reports Notion’s rollout of AI-enabled agents to assist with data analysis and task automation across Notion workspaces, detailing capabilities and integration with existing features.

articles.title: Google now lets you share your custom Gemini AI assistants known as Gems
articles.summary: TechCrunch describes Google’s feature allowing sharing of Gemini-based AI assistants (Gems), including sharing mechanisms, access controls, and privacy considerations.

articles.title: How Xi Is Using a TikTok Tradeoff to Court Trump
articles.summary: NYT analyzes China potentially leveraging TikTok negotiations as part of a broader bargaining package with the US, with implications for tariffs, tech governance, and Taiwan policy.

articles.title: Trump and Xi Are Set to Finalize TikTok Deal
articles.summary: NYT reports US and China nearing agreement on TikTok governance, including data localization and audits, and discusses potential implications for tech competition and global markets.

articles.title: Autocrats Move Quickly to Fill Void as Trump Retreats From the U.N.
articles.summary: NYT describes how China and Russia are seeking influence at the UN as the US reduces engagement, with potential consequences for international governance.

articles.title: The Race to Make Rare Earth Magnets Outside China Is On
articles.summary: NYT examines efforts to diversify production of rare earth magnets away from China and the geopolitical implications for tech supply chains.

articles.title: Taliban ban female authors on universities
articles.summary: NOS reports the Taliban barred books by female authors from university curricula, placing this within broader educational and civil-rights restrictions.

articles.title: Brits freed by Taliban after months in detention
articles.summary: NOS reports the release of an elderly British couple detained by the Taliban after months in custody, with context on diplomatic considerations.

articles.title: AOC eyes 2028 presidential run
articles.summary: Axios notes speculation about Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez pursuing a presidential bid in 2028 and discusses potential electoral strategy and policy implications.

articles.title: Top Biden aide admits president struggled in final years in office
articles.summary: Axios reports a top Biden administration aide acknowledging the president faced struggles in his final years, with implications for legacy and messaging.

articles.title: Senate Republicans squirm over FCC comments on Jimmy Kimmel
articles.summary: Axios describes Republican senators’ hesitation to attack FCC Chair Carr after comments about Jimmy Kimmel, reflecting political calculations on media regulation.

articles.title: Senate passes 'National Day of Remembrance for Charlie Kirk'
articles.summary: Axios reports the Senate passing a resolution to create a National Day of Remembrance for Charlie Kirk, noting White House and Republican reactions.

articles.title: Providers face hard decisions with Medicaid cuts
articles.summary: Axios covers how Medicaid cuts affect healthcare providers, including budget pressures and patient access.

articles.title: Exclusive: Google's wish list for the new USPTO director
articles.summary: Axios discusses Google’s preferred policy directions for the USPTO leadership, including patent examination standards and regulation affecting innovation.

articles.title: Yes, Jimmy Kimmel’s suspension was government censorship
articles.summary: The Verge analyzes the suspension of Jimmy Kimmel and related regulatory/public-interest questions, including a Senate inquiry into FCC communications.

articles.title: How Outrage at Kimmel Grew to a Shout From a Whisper
articles.summary: NYT traces how online posts and media commentary amplified Jimmy Kimmel’s monologue into a political controversy, examining digital amplification and editorial pressure.

articles.title: What Jimmy Kimmel’s Suspension Says About Free Speech
articles.summary: NYT analyzes implications for free speech and corporate policy in media following Kimmel’s suspension.

articles.title: WK atletiek: nu halve finale 5.000m met Laros, later finale 400m horden met Bol
articles.summary: NOS reports live coverage of day seven at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, highlighting the 5,000m semi-final and the 400m hurdles final.

articles.title: Twente treft bekerhouder Arsenal en Engels kampioen Chelsea in Champions League
articles.summary: NOS notes FC Twente drawing Arsenal and Chelsea for the Champions League group stage, emphasizing the strength of the English clubs.

articles.title: Norris snelste in rommelige eerste vrije training Bakoe • 'Teams tasten nog in het duister'
articles.summary: NOS reports Norris as fastest in a chaotic first free practice session for the Azerbaijan Grand Prix, with teams still adjusting setups.

articles.title: Synchroonzussen De Brouwer beëindigen carrière: 'Het verhaal is af'
articles.summary: NOS announces the retirement of identical twins Noortje and Bregje de Brouwer from synchronized swimming, highlighting their major 2024 achievements.

articles.title: De nieuwe roman van Peter Buwalda stijgt boven zichzelf uit. In De Jaknikker wordt een verrassende laag aangeboord
articles.summary: NRC reviews Peter Buwalda’s novel De Jaknikker, noting it goes beyond previous work and adds a surprising depth.

articles.title: Lea Ypi speurt naar het leven van haar grootmoeder én naar de grote geschiedenis
articles.summary: NRC discusses Lea Ypi’s book that blends a personal portrait with larger historical context and themes of memory and identity.

articles.title: What does Blue Origin do? Explaining all the company’s programs
articles.summary: SpaceExplored provides a primer on Blue Origin’s programs and their role in private space activity.

articles.title: All of the best iPhone 17 cases [Update #3]
articles.summary: 9to5Mac rounds up top iPhone 17 cases from trusted brands, with notes on protection, style, and pricing.

articles.title: First iPhone 17 pre-orders now arriving to customers
articles.summary: 9to5Mac reports that iPhone 17 pre-orders (and other Apple devices) are arriving in New Zealand and Australia as regional rollout begins.

articles.title: EU seeks developer input on Apple’s proposed changes to App Store rules
articles.summary: EU solicits developer feedback on Apple App Store rule changes ahead of Digital Markets Act compliance.

articles.title: iPhone Air MagSafe Battery teardown reveals a surprisingly familiar component inside
articles.summary: iFixIt teardown notes a familiar internal component in Apple’s Air MagSafe Battery, suggesting a manufacturing efficiency.

articles.title: iOS 26’s new Battery feature can help save a draining iPhone
articles.summary: 9to5Mac explains iOS 26 Battery feature improvements to help extend iPhone life and optimize battery health.

articles.title: Federico Viticci’s in-depth iOS 26 review: A new era for Apple’s software
articles.summary: 9to5Mac highlights Viticci’s iOS 26 review, noting a broad set of changes and evaluating early impact on daily use.

articles.title: iOS 26.0.1 coming soon for iPhone users
articles.summary: 9to5Mac reports a bug-fix update (iOS 26.0.1) is in development to address early issues after the major release.

articles.title: Apple TV+ unveils new crime thriller from creator of The Blacklist
articles.summary: 9to5Mac notes Apple TV+ expanding its fall slate with a new crime thriller from The Blacklist creator and shares a trailer.

articles.title: Photographer Austin Mann reviews the iPhone 17 Pro cameras
articles.summary: Austin Mann provides an in-depth field review of the iPhone 17 Pro cameras, focusing on image quality and features.

articles.title: Dit najaar strengere controles op 'sjoemelkortingen' van webwinkels
articles.summary: NOS reports ACM will increase oversight this autumn to tackle misleading online discounts and practices.

articles.title: Gevangenen komen nu vrijwel altijd twee weken eerder vrij door cellentekort
articles.summary: NOS covers earlier releases of inmates due to cell shortage, shortening detention by about two weeks and discussing risks and system pressures.

articles.title: Overleden Amerikaanse vrouw na tientallen jaren geïdentificeerd via DNA zus
articles.summary: NOS reports a deceased American woman identified after decades through DNA matching with a sister.

articles.title: Taliban verbieden boeken van vrouwelijke auteurs op universiteiten
articles.summary: NOS notes Taliban forbidding books by female authors from university curricula.

introText: Today's digest covers Meta's AR eyewear and streaming initiatives, Apple's iPhone 17 lineup and related hardware tests, and the latest AI and chip funding. It also highlights political developments in the U.S. and Europe, major crime and security stories, sports results, and cultural reporting. The articles come from The Verge, TechCrunch, Hacker News, The New York Times, NRC, NOS, 9to5Mac, Axios, and others.

articles.title: I regret to inform you Meta’s new smart glasses are the best I’ve ever tried
articles.summary: The Verge reviews Meta’s Ray-Ban Display glasses, priced around $800, evaluating the built-in display’s usefulness for directions, imagery, translations, and overlays, plus comfort and battery life.

articles.title: Apple iPhone Air review: statement piece
articles.summary: Verge discusses the iPhone Air as a design-oriented option within Apple’s lineup, weighing design language, ecosystem integration, and expected trade-offs in battery and camera performance.

articles.title: Meta Connect 2025: the 6 biggest announcements
articles.summary: A roundup of six anticipated announcements at Meta Connect 2025 across hardware and software, with emphasis on eyewear updates and platform strategies.

articles.title: The iPhone 17 is the one to get this year
articles.summary: Verge verdict: the iPhone 17 offers the best balance of features and price in Apple’s 2025 lineup, with emphasis on battery life, camera, software, and ecosystem integration.

articles.title: The iPhone 17 Pro is a bold redesign but a basic upgrade
articles.summary: The iPhone 17 Pro is a design-forward upgrade with incremental performance gains and a premium price, appealing to enthusiasts more than casual users.

articles.title: Ray-Ban’s website posts a “We’ll be back soon” note ahead of Meta Connect
articles.summary: Ray-Ban’s site displayed a “We’ll be back soon” message ahead of Meta Connect, signaling expected announcements and generating anticipation.

articles.title: Microsoft is giving Notepad free AI features
articles.summary: Microsoft adds free AI features to Notepad (summarize, write, rewrite) using local AI models; rollout to Copilot Plus PC users and Windows Insiders; privacy considerations discussed.

articles.title: Meta is bringing an all-in-one movie and TV streaming hub to Quest headsets
articles.summary: Meta plans a unified streaming hub on Quest to simplify VR media consumption, with considerations for app support and performance.

articles.title: Meta unveils new smart glasses with a display and wristband controller
articles.summary: Meta introduces a new generation of smart glasses featuring a built-in display and a wristband controller for hands-free AR interaction, with discussions of specs and use cases.

articles.title: Airbuds is the music social network Apple and Spotify wish they had built
articles.summary: Airbuds is presented as a music-focused social network, exploring its concept, potential ecosystem integrations, monetization, and early traction.

articles.title: Meta launches Hyperscape, technology to turn real-world spaces into VR
articles.summary: Hyperscape enables VR experiences in real-world spaces, with applications in events, retail, and entertainment, plus privacy considerations.

articles.title: India leads the way on Google’s Nano Banana with a local creative twist
articles.summary: India pioneers local adaptations of Google’s Nano Banana concept, affecting regional content ecosystems and Google’s strategy in India.

articles.title: Meta unveils its new Oakley Meta Vanguard smart glasses for athletes
articles.summary: Oakley Vanguard glasses tailored for athletes with enhanced display and potential performance-tracking features, including market positioning and availability.

articles.title: WASM 3.0 Completed
articles.summary: WebAssembly 3.0 completed; expected to impact performance, portability, tooling, and ecosystem growth across runtimes.

articles.title: A postmortem of three recent issues
articles.summary: Anthropic engineering postmortem examining three incidents, detailing root causes, remediation, and process improvements.

articles.title: One Token to rule them all – Obtaining Global Admin in every Entra ID tenant
articles.summary: Security discussion about attacker tokens that could grant global admin across Entra ID tenants and corresponding mitigations.

articles.summary: Alibaba announces a new AI chip with specs compared to Huawei H2O; explores architecture, memory, compute, and use cases.

articles.summary: Introductory guide to building a hypervisor in Rust, covering virtualization concepts, safety, and implementation trade-offs.

articles.summary: Policy analysis on Republicans framing Charlie Kirk’s influence within free-speech debates and regulatory responses.

articles.summary: Analysis of Senator Thune’s use of a nuclear option and its implications for minority rights and Senate norms.

articles.summary: Democrats propose more than $1 trillion in health spending amid looming government shutdown and budget negotiations.

introText: This digest covers technology and AI developments, major geopolitical events including the Gaza conflict and US-China tech tensions, and economics and markets. It also highlights Dutch politics and notable cultural obituaries.

categories.commentary: Technology product news, AI, robotics, and software updates.

articles.title: The iPhone 17 is the one to get this year
articles.summary: The Verge argues the standard iPhone 17 offers a compelling balance of speed, battery life, and value, with improvements to display and energy efficiency, making it a strong option relative to Pro and Air variants.

articles.title: The iPhone 17 Pro is a bold redesign but a basic upgrade
articles.summary: The iPhone 17 Pro features a design refresh and stronger hardware but remains a modest upgrade over the previous generation, with questions about whether new features justify the price for everyday use.

articles.title: Meta’s new smart glasses are coming this week
articles.summary: The Verge previews Meta’s upcoming smart glasses, outlining expected hardware features and software integration within Meta’s AR strategy ahead of Meta Connect 2025.

articles.title: How to watch Mark Zuckerberg’s keynote at Meta Connect 2025
articles.summary: This explainer covers scheduling and streaming options for Meta’s Connect 2025 keynote and what audiences might expect from product announcements.

articles.title: Waymo to launch a robotaxi service in Nashville in 2026
articles.summary: Waymo plans to launch a robotaxi service in Nashville by 2026, discussing potential rider experience considerations, regulatory hurdles, and partnerships.

articles.title: Sony’s PS5 update adds controller swapping and Power Saving mode
articles.summary: The PS5 software update introduces controller swapping and a Power Saving mode, with implications for energy efficiency and daily use.

articles.title: The Apple Watch SE 3 is the one to buy
articles.summary: The Apple Watch SE 3 is presented as the strongest value in Apple’s wearables, offering good battery life and everyday usability at a lower price point.

articles.title: Casio’s stress-relieving furry robot MOFLIN is coming to the US
articles.summary: Casio’s MOFLIN furry robot, designed as a stress-relief companion, will be available in the United States.

articles.title: iPhone Air review: The thinnest iPhone ever, but at what cost?
articles.summary: The iPhone Air is described as the thinnest iPhone yet, with a design trade-off between extreme slenderness and practicality, prompting questions about the trade-offs involved.

articles.title: iPhone 17 Pro review: How pro can you go?
articles.summary: Hands-on testing of the iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max assesses whether the Pro models deliver meaningful enhancements in speed and power and whether they justify flagship status.

articles.title: Here are all the new features in iOS 26, iPadOS 26, macOS Tahoe
articles.summary: Apple has published official feature lists across iOS 26, iPadOS 26, and macOS Tahoe, directing readers to the documentation for full details.

articles.title: Kuo: Apple to launch touch screen Macs, starting with OLED MacBook Pro
articles.summary: Ming-Chi Kuo says Apple plans touchscreen Macs, beginning with an OLED MacBook Pro, with production timing potentially slipping beyond 2026.

articles.title: After years of touchscreen Mac rumors, here’s why I believe the latest one
articles.summary: Opinion discusses why the latest touchscreen Mac rumor warrants consideration, noting a history of prototypes since 2008 and ongoing experimentation.

articles.title: On iOS 26 with a T-Satellite plan? These six iPhone apps work via satellite
articles.summary: iOS 26 enables six iPhone apps to operate via satellite, with no need to select T-Mobile as the carrier.

articles.title: Car Keys in Wallet are about to launch for these three vehicle brands
articles.summary: WWDC notes car keys in Wallet would roll out to 13 brands; the first three brands are expected to launch soon.

articles.title: Apple Vision Pro gains support for digital prism correction
articles.summary: Vision Pro adds digital prism correction in visionOS 26, improving accessibility for prescription users.

articles.title: Terra Oleo’s oil-producing microbes could replace destructive palm oil plantations
articles.summary: Terra Oleo explores microbe-based oil production as a substitute for palm oil to reduce deforestation and biodiversity loss, outlining technical and regulatory considerations.

articles.title: Silicon Valley bets big on environments to train AI agents
articles.summary: The piece analyzes the rise of synthetic or simulated environments for training AI agents, discussing benefits for rapid experimentation and potential limitations in real-world transfer.

articles.title: Gemini tops the App Store thanks to new AI image model, Nano Banana
articles.summary: Gemini's Nano Banana AI image model boosts App Store performance, with analysis of AI-generated imagery affecting app engagement.

articles.title: Lyft and Waymo are partnering to bring robotaxis to Nashville
articles.summary: Lyft and Waymo announce a partnership to deploy robotaxis in Nashville, with pilots, safety considerations, and timing details.

articles.title: Icarus raises $6.1M to take on space’s “warehouse work” with embodied-AI robots
articles.summary: Icarus secures $6.1 million to pursue embodied-AI robotics for space-based warehousing tasks, outlining technology and roadmap.

articles.summary: Groww aims to go public as part of a broader cross-border investment shift, with implications for Indian fintech and the startup ecosystem.

articles.summary: Live coverage of Google I/O 2025 highlights announcements including Google AI Ultra, Project Mariner, and Gemini app updates.

articles.summary: An analysis argues that continued military pressure complicates diplomacy and risks entrenching positions on both sides.
